Cheese is high in protein,
calcium, vitamin D and potassium.

Broccoli is high in fiber,
phyto-nutrients and flavonoids
which are great cancer fighters.

Cucumbers are a good source
of potassium.

Cantaloupe includes carotene
and lutein in it’s long list of benefits.

Beets are an excellent source
of foliate, for DNA synthesis.

The phyto-chemicals in the cabbage
fight cancer and reduce LDL
or “bad” cholesterol.

Almonds are high in
vitamin E.

Apples have pectin, an important
water soluble fiber.
Be sure to wash well since
a lot of pesticide is used on apples.

Cranberries are high in antioxidants
and contain vitamin E.

Strawberries high vitamin C content
makes it an immunity booster.

Carrots have lots of
anti-oxidants.

Basil’s essential oils are
anti-inflammatory and anti-bacterial.

Lemons are blood purifiers
and cleansing agents.

Caulifloweris filled with
cancer fighting phyto-chemicals
and plant sterols.

Mint aids in digestion
and can clear congestion!

Avocado is a fruit with healthy
monounsaturated fat.
Healthy and yummy!

Dill is rich in vitamin A and C
and beta carotene.

Tomatoes are a source of lycopene
which protects the skin from UV rays.

The bitter taste of the radicchio comes
from lactucopicrin – an anti-malarial
with a sedative and
painkilling effect.

One cup of lettuce equals 250%
of the daily requirement
of Vitamin A!

Onions are high in chromium,
which is a trace mineral
that helps cells respond to
insulin levels in the blood.

Watermelons are 90% water
but are still filled with vitamins
like A and C plus antioxidants.

Spinach is a great source
of Vitamin K which is good
for strengthening bones.

Peppers contain capsaicin with
anti-carcinogenic, anti-diabetic
and analgesic (pain relieving)
properties.
